announcements.content: 2025년 봄학기 인공지능대학원/AI시스템공학과로 학석사 연계 신청하시는 학생 중 HLI Lab에 들어오시기 희망하시는 분은 2024년 6월 7일 23:59까지 jy.bak@skku.edu로 자기소개서와 CV를 첨부하여 메일 보내주세요.

contents.title: Intro
contents.content:
## About

Hello, I am a master's student at the department of artificial intelligence at SungKyunKwan University (SKKU). 
My research interests are sentiment analysis and applying it to open-domain chatbot for better human similarity.

### About *** Hello. I am Dongjun Kang.
I am a student at Sungkyunkwan University (SKKU).
I'm interested in Large Language Models, Persuasion, Personalization. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact. Last update: Nov 2023

contents.title: Intro
contents.content:
## About 
I am a Ph.D. student at Sungkyunkwan University (SKKU), advised by Professor JinYeong Bak in the Human Language Intelligence Lab. 

Concurrently, I am participating in the Ph.D. Collaborator program with Microsoft Research.  
In collaboration with Dr. Young Jin Kim, I am exploring effective fine-tuning techniques for a generative model.  
 
My research focuses on natural language processing, parameter-efficient fine-tuning, retrieval augmented generation, and the analysis of deep learning models.

contents.content:
## Work Experience

- Research Intern, **Deargen Inc**, (Summer, 2022)  
  I interned with Dr. Bonggun Shin in Deargen USA. I analyzed the differences in synthetic essentiality (SE) scores by inserting new fingerprint data into a cancer dependency prediction model that contains cancer cell lines (CCLs) with different mutation environments.

**JinYeong Bak**  
jy.bak@skku.edu

contents.title: Intro
contents.content:
## About

Greetings! I'm a Master student at SungKyunKwan University in Human Language Intelligence Lab. I'm particularly interested in **how languages vary among different communties**, as (online) communities grow in a world-scale. That's why my research mainly focuses on **specialized vocabulary for social groups in Neural Machine Translation**. Inspired by this research and recent advance in large language models, now I am also curious on how user-centered design of AI product can change usability for online users, whose needs are various. 

My journey into this fascinating field has been shaped by a rather unique and diverse background: With a Bachelor's degree in Confucian Studies and Eastern Philosophy, I delved into the profound philosophies that have shaped societies for centuries. Alongside, I also delved into subjects seemingly unrelated yet equally intriguing, such as Construction and Landscape Architecture designing. **The multitude of lexicons, nuances, and meanings woven into these diverse communities captured my interest in linguistic diversity, ultimately guiding me to the captivating NLP.**

If you have any questions or would like to know about me XD, please contact me! I'm always happy to connect with others who share my interests! :D
